items.summary: North Melbourne outclasses the Brisbane Lions by 40 points in the AFLW grand final to capture a history-making second consecutive premiership.

items.title: Albanese and Haydon have wed in a ceremony that will go down in history
items.summary: Anthony Albanese and Jodie Haydon can trace their relationship back five years, but the historic nature of their secretly planned wedding at The Lodge runs far deeper.

items.title: Anthony Albanese's wedding ends this 'killing season' with love's triumph
items.summary: The two months preceding a wedding are notoriously hazardous. But consider the two months Anthony Albanese has just had.

items.title: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese marries Jodie Haydon at The Lodge in Canberra
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese marries his partner Jodie Haydon in a private ceremony at his official Canberra residence, after details of the wedding were kept top secret.

items.title: England captain Ben Stokes dismisses 'arrogant' label amid criticism of Ashes Test loss to Australia
items.summary: Captain Ben Stokes responds to England's critics in the wake of the defeat to Australia in the first Test, maintaining his squad will not step back from its aggressive approach.

items.title: Best books out in November, featuring Margaret Atwood's memoir and The Mushroom Tapes
items.summary: Wondering what to read next? This month's best books include a novel that brings to life Britain's only named wind and a new book by the author of The Handmaid's Tale.

items.title: No-bake chocolate and strawberry cake is the ultimate make-ahead dessert - ABC News
items.summary: Icebox cakes are retro no-bake desserts made by layering store-bought biscuits and whipped cream. A no-fuss option for summer celebrations, this one can be assembled in 10 minutes and made well ahead of time.

items.title: Colin Friels takes on his final stage role in King Lear at Belvoir in Sydney
items.summary: Colin Friels, the award-winning actor known for Malcolm and Water Rats, reflects on his 50-year career on stage and screen as he approaches what might be his final role.

items.title: Terminated Bedford staff in limbo, with millions of dollars owed in entitlements
items.summary: Former Bedford staff have said they are owed millions of dollars in entitlements after they were made redundant when the disability employment provider entered voluntary administration earlier this year.

items.title: Victorian coroner determines Mount Buller hiker missing since 2019 is dead
items.summary: A Coroner has determined that Niels Gunther Becker, 39, who went missing at Mount Buller in 2019 is dead but that no third party was involved.

items.title: Planning to bite into a sweet, juicy mango? Here's what to know about your favourite summer treat
items.summary: What's the difference between a big R2E2, a delicate Honey Gold, and an iconic Kensington Pride? Find out before biting into a mango this season.

items.title: Parramatta River gets new swimming spot at Gladesville's Bedlam Bay
items.summary: While new swimming areas have opened along the river in recent years, an election promise to open a Western Sydney location has stalled.

items.title: Skyhooks guitarist Bob Starkie dies aged 73 after a battle with cancer
items.summary: A statement released on Skyhooks' official Facebook page announced his passing this morning.

items.title: RBA could hike interest rates in early 2026 as banks rewrite forecasts
items.summary: Hotter-than-expected inflation figures have caught most economists and policy makers off guard. The ongoing price pressures in the economy open the door for an RBA interest rate hike in 2026.

items.title: Mother 'devastated' by police decision to drop murder charges in Kaiden Morgan-Johnston stabbing case
items.summary: A 19-year-old man has been released from custody after police withdrew charges against him.

items.title: Girl Guides still going strong in Western Australia after 110 years
items.summary: The uniforms and pledge may have had a revamp, but the learning, friendships and camping trips at Girl Guides are just as relevant for a new generation more than a century after the organisation first began.

items.title: Melbourne teen who died after nut allergy 'let down' by health system, family says
items.summary: Four years after a 15-year-old boy died due to a nut allergy, a Victorian coroner is examining if the death was preventable and whether paramedics and doctors at the Box Hill Hospital provided appropriate care.

items.title: Conservationists worldwide scrambling for alternative funding after USAID cuts
items.summary: Citizen science and AI have never been more important to the environment after White House cuts to USAID are felt beneath the waves, a new report says.

items.title: Snowy Mountains farmers call for support in managing spread of invasive weed African lovegrass
items.summary: To the untrained eye, African lovegrass is just another plant in the NSW Snowy Mountains. But this golden plant is a deceptive invasive weed that is choking out the landscape, causing some farmers to leave the land.

items.title: South-East Asia flood deaths rise as Cyclone Ditwah hits Sri Lanka, heads towards southern India
items.summary: Parts of South-East Asia have been hit with record levels of rain as a cyclone hits Sri Lanka, causing floods and landslides, as the system heads towards India.

items.title: 'Mineral’ sunscreens found to have almost identical chemicals as others, testing shows
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Australia's peak music exam body under fire amid claims of 'slipping standards'
items.summary: It is held up as the "gold standard" of music testing in the country, but there are claims the Australian Music Examinations Board is letting down talented students.

items.title: 'Naughty Boy' pelican draws in visitors and locals in coastal tourist town of Kalbarri
items.summary: Locals say this cheeky pelican has a personality unlike any bird they have ever seen.

items.title: Who's thriving and who's barely surviving in Australia, the Land of the Parrots?
items.summary: Australia is the land of the parrot — few places in the world have such a dazzling array of colourful and clever members of the psittacine family.

items.title: Severe Tropical Cyclone Fina damage exposes need for new Royal Darwin Hospital
items.summary: A new Royal Darwin Hospital would cost more than $1 billion to build, and likely take a decade or more to deliver. So who has the political bravery to commit?

items.title: Melbourne Airport terminal fire under investigation after evacuation of Qantas domestic terminal
items.summary: A fire that forced the evacuation of Melbourne's Qantas domestic terminal on Friday night continues to be investigated.

items.title: After suffering 'terrifying' postpartum rage, this mother wants others to know they're not alone
items.summary: When Ali Gossage gave birth a second time, she did not experience the constant joys of motherhood. Instead, she was sometimes filled with "terrifying" anger.

items.title: Survivors of forced adoption in South Australia call for greater recognition
items.summary: Decades on from Australia's forced adoption era, just two states have set up a redress scheme for the mothers who were harmed. Survivors are calling for South Australia to take similar action — warning time is running out.

items.title: Cricket Australia set to speak with Usman Khawaja after he labelled Perth Ashes Test pitch a 'piece of shit'
items.summary: Usman Khawaja may face a sanction for labelling the first Ashes Test surface a "piece of shit", with Cricket Australia understood to be disappointed by the remarks.

items.title: Think you're ready to own a home? Here are the costs that experts want you to consider
items.summary: We asked three financial experts about the up-front and ongoing costs of buying a home and for their tips on how to prepare for home ownership.

items.title: About 90 Jetstar flights cancelled due to global recall of Airbus A320 planes
items.summary: About 90 Jetstar flights have been cancelled across Australia today due to a global recall of Airbus A320 planes for urgent software repairs.

items.title: From potential gridlock to an "immersive" viewing experience, planning documents reveal details about the building at the heart of Tasmania's fiery stadium debate.
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: What would it be like to visit Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium?
items.summary: From potential gridlock to an "immersive" viewing experience, let's set aside the politics — just for a moment — and look at what planning documents tell us about the building at the heart of Tasmania's fiery stadium debate.

items.title: Former premier Peter Gutwein says Hobart AFL stadium has been 'poorly' sold
items.summary: Peter Gutwein initiated the push for a stadium in Hobart, but he has had to watch the drama unfold from the sidelines. He says rejecting the proposal would be the biggest "lost opportunity" in the state's history.

items.title: Sydney Thunder miss out on WBBL win as Adelaide Strikers clash ended early by rain
items.summary: After rain falls for most of the Sydney Thunder's innings, umpires decide to call off their WBBL clash against the Strikers with Phoebe Litchfield one swing away from ending the game.

items.title: Inquiry into male suicide rates hears migrants left feeling 'invisible, unheard and completely lost’ in Australia
items.summary: Men make up more than 75 per cent of all suicide deaths in Australia, but Lifeline says they only make up about 40 per cent of helpline service users — and even when men do seek help they experienced "high levels of disengagement".

items.title: Adoption support service warns against increasing adoption in Queensland
items.summary: Queensland should overhaul "outdated" adoption laws that sever children's legal ties to their families, while ensuring adoption remains a last resort, a peak support service tells a commission of inquiry.

items.title: Google's global data hub plan for Christmas Island gets mixed reviews from locals
items.summary: Google's plans for a data hub could drag this remote island from a digitally starved past into an AI-powered future. But are the locals ready?

items.title: Man charged with murder after public place shooting in Blacktown
items.summary: Mal Seve, 28, died after suffering gunshot wounds to his neck, chest and leg in Blacktown on Friday.

items.title: Australia's emissions have dropped, but we've got our work cut out to reach targets
items.summary: Australia's emissions had the biggest drop ever this year outside the artificial kink in the curve during COVID-19 shutdowns, but there's still a lot of work to do.

items.title: Crowdy Bay shark attack highlights need for first aid devices, drone surveillance on remote beaches
items.summary: A makeshift tourniquet may have made the difference between a shark attack on the NSW Mid North Coast this week claiming one life not two. The attack has put a spotlight on how fatalities may be prevented.

items.title: R360 launch postponed from 2026 to 2028, after players withdraw due to threats of NRL bans
items.summary: Threats of long bans for prospective R360 players prompted "a handful" of them to withdraw from the rebel league, which now says it will launch in 2028 instead of next year.

items.title: Lawyers warn erroneous and costly family court transcripts are impeding justice, prompting calls for change
items.summary: Obtaining court transcripts can cost thousands of dollars for a single day of proceedings, but the documents can contain errors, missing text, and even wrong attribution, frustrating legal practitioners who say the flaws impede justice.

items.title: King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard on quitting Spotify, orchestras, raves, and world domination
items.summary: Their rock, rave and orchestral music attracts a cult global following. But the prolific, chaotic King Gizzard & the Lizard Wizard are just "at peace with failing".

items.title: Normalisation of location sharing, tech-facilitated abuse in spotlight after Lilie James inquest
items.summary: Experts on gendered violence have warned against the proliferation of everyday location sharing tools to control victim-survivors after NSW's top coroner found Paul Thijssen used them to track Lilie James before her murder.

items.title: Hong Kong tower residents had safety complaints more than 12 months before deadly fires
items.summary: Many of the people who managed to escape the Wang Fuk Court fires in Hong Kong believe the disaster could have been prevented, saying they had flagged safety concerns more than a year ago.

items.title: Cape Barren Island was returned for Aboriginal self-governance 20 years ago
items.summary: Twenty years ago, Cape Barren Island was handed back to its traditional owners. Today's children are proof of the life-changing power of that act.

items.title: Director Peter Weir on capturing the mood for Picnic at Hanging Rock
items.summary: Renowned Australian director Peter Weir gives a rare behind-the-scenes insight into what made Picnic at Hanging Rock such a memorable and enduring film.

items.title: John 'Wacka' Williams labels Barnaby Joyce's resignation an 'act of treason'
items.summary: The MP's resignation from the Nationals surprised no one, but drew ire from members of the party. Those on the ground in his electorate have a more mixed view.

items.title: Growing concern filler doesn't break down even with hyaluronidase dissolver
items.summary: As more people turn towards cosmetic injectable "journeys", Lana is sounding the alarm about the risks of developing long-term side effects.

items.title: Family, advocates welcome 'historic' police conviction over Jai Wright's death
items.summary: For the family of Dunghutti teen Jai Wright, the guilty finding against police officer Benedict Bryant for dangerous driving occasioning Jai's death lifts a "weight off their shoulders". Legal experts say it's the first time a police officer has been convicted in relation to the death of a First Nations person in custody.

items.title: The first Australian-made car, the Holden 48-215, was introduced to the world on this day
items.summary: The first fully Australian-made car rolled off the Holden production line in Melbourne on this day in 1948. The man who dreamt it up wasn't there to see it unveiled.

items.title: Albanese knows the power dynamic between Labor and mining interests has shifted
items.summary: There has been a shift in the power dynamic between Labor and the mining industry. This week's environmental law reform is its embodiment.

items.title: Eight arrested and 128 people dead as alarm faults confirmed in Hong Kong fire
items.summary: The arrests come as the probe into what caused the deadly blaze that killed at least 128 people continues.

items.title: ICC rejects plea to release Philippine ex-president Rodrigo Duterte
items.summary: The judge says it is "necessary" for the 80-year-old to remain in detention as the conditions proposed by his lawyers do not meet the conditions for parole.

items.title: Qantas terminal at Melbourne Airport evacuated and flights delayed due to fire
items.summary: The Qantas terminal is re-opening after being evacuated because of a small fire inside Melbourne Airport.

items.title: Wala Kooral-bi juvenile justice facility opens in northern WA
items.summary: An on-country youth diversion facility has been built in the state's far north, offering a culturally grounded alternative to traditional youth justice programs.

items.title: One of seven Rosenberg's goannas from ACT reserve is missing from home for second time in two years
items.summary: One of a handful of Rosenberg’s goannas living in the ACT’s hill reserves has once again wandered off, prompting calls from a local conservation organisation for help bringing him back.

items.title: Hong Kong's aging towers face urgent questions after city's deadliest blaze in decades
items.summary: Hong Kong's worst fire in decades exposed long-standing weaknesses in its aging residential blocks. The question haunting the city is whether the disaster could happen again.

items.title: Kyra Cooney-Cross scores stunning long range goal as Matildas down New Zealand 5-0
items.summary: A spectacular long range effort from Kyra Cooney-Cross has helped the Matildas to a dominant 5-0 win over New Zealand in Australia's penultimate game before hosting the Asian Cup in March.

items.title: Perth hacker Michael Clapsis jailed after setting up fake Qantas Wi-Fi, stealing sex videos
items.summary: A Perth hacker who copied intimate images and sex videos from women's personal online accounts and set up fake Wi-Fi on Qantas flights is sentenced to more than seven years in prison.

items.title: Boy won't face charges after Melbourne primary school stabbing, police say
items.summary: Police say a boy who allegedly stabbed a child at a Berwick primary school will not face charges as he is under the age of criminal responsibility.

items.title: Lotterywest cancels licences of seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco or vapes
items.summary: Seven stores across Perth found to be selling illegal tobacco and vapes have their lotteries licences terminated, as attempts to disrupt the illicit and growing trade continues.

items.title: Struggling AFLW teams GWS, Collingwood and Gold Coast receive extra picks or list spots from league
items.summary: Three of the AFLW's worst-performing clubs will receive boosts to their lists, with the help announced the day before the grand final.

items.title: Preparing my garden for time away in summer
items.summary: Leaving my garden in the heat of summer can feel worrying but some simple planning means it misses me less than I miss it.
